content.description: A nasty, mossy crack that leads toward a ledge with a pine tree.  Included primarily as a navigation point so you can find other routes.
content.protection: Standard rack but expect it to be wet and slippery
content.location: 20 feet right of Franny and Zooey corner.

content.description: Look for a very straight and even 4 inch crack in a large right-facing corner.
content.protection: #2-#4 Camalots. Doubles are recommended of #3.
content.location: At far right of crag. You can scramble up/down about 40 feet further to the right.

content.description: Stem and squeeze up the short chimney. Shift right at the roof and follow the blocky corner to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack with some large cams
content.location: About 15 feet right of where the Metacomet trail descends from the cliff base.

content.description: A variation to Franny and Zoey.  Begin about 20 feet left of the normal route below a left-facing corner.  At the top of the corner, traverse right on the ledge and finish on the regular route.
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: Starts between Climbing Bind and Franny and Zoey.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Skirt around the opening of the boulder cave on the left and follow the crack over the opening that leads to the right side of a beige gap where a block fell off. Move right over the block that has not yet fallen off and continue up the slot to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack with some larger cams.  Walk off left on hiking trail.
content.location: Above the upper opening of the boulder cave.

content.description: Short crescent-shaped chimney
content.protection: Standard rack
content.location: Walk off left on blue-blazed trail.  You can also scramble down a ways to the right.

content.description: Climb the small crack that leads to a left-facing corner.
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: On the left side of the wall above the upper opening of the boulder cave.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Layback and jam up the beautiful left facing corner system that shares the start of 'Down-to-Earth'.  reach the roof on bomber holds and decent rest.  hand traverse out right on a ledge (that doesn't take pro like it looks it should) to the arête and short face above.  Pull the crux up to this arête and short face to the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack. Hand sized cams for the left facing corner start.  The dirty/ loose hand traverse ledge doesn't take anything before the crux
content.location: Left side of Rattlesnake.  Look for the Down-to-Earth roof and a left facing corner.  The start is the obvious beautiful left facing corner.  walk down to the left (south on blue blazed Metacomet trail) brings you back around to base of cliff

content.description: Scramble up the large, blocky left-facing corner with a big crack in the back.
content.protection: Standard rack with some larger cams.
content.location: About 30 feet left of where the Metacomet trail descends from the cliff base.

content.description: Start near the middle of the face.  Climb up over two horizontal overlaps,  Follow the contour of the third overlap up and right to a good hold.  Then head left to a small left-facing corner.  When you reach the roof, traverse left and pull that sucker beneath a small left-facing corner.
content.protection: Small stuff
content.location: About 15 feet right of the Near Miss arête.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Start beneath the left-facing Three Stooges corner. Ascend straight up the corner and the brown water stain above it.
content.protection: Originally led on hooks.  Best considered a top-rope.
content.location: Between Climbing Bind crack and Franny and Zoey corner.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Follow the left-facing corner and arch, then straight up to the top through a awkward horizontal crack.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Trees at top suitable for TR anchors.
content.location: Starts just to the right of the Boulder Cave. Walk off left on blue-blazed trail.

content.description: Crack to the right of the Boulder cave. Start up the detached block to the overhanging crack. Continue up healthy hand jams to an easily layback. Climb the middle of the upper face with small protection and top out.
content.protection: Standard trad rack'll do.

content.description: To the right of the large overhang on the left side of the crag is a short crack which offers a nice moderate climb.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.

climbs.name: Near Miss
climbs.fa: Ken Nichols, Bob Clark, Bill Sullivan, July 1981

content.description: Climb the arête.  At the roof move left and follow the small crack to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack
content.location: Far left of crag.  Walk off left on trail.

content.description:
Climb up 10 feet through the moss in the center of the wall to a ledge.  Then follow the right-facing corner to the top. 

  The following top-rope routes are on the same face (L->R): 

 Snake Charmer 5.11 Medusa's Face 5.9+ Mother Russia Nest of Snakes 5.9 Puff Adder 5.10 Hognose 5.5 (arête)
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: About 40 feet right of where the Metacomet Trail descends from the cliff base.  Look for distinctive wall divided into three neat sections by a horizontal ledge and a right-facing corner.

content.description: The furthest right flake/crack on the wall with the large boulder beneath. Best protected if you start under the cave and work out to the left-handed crack above the large boulder. Climb up the double cracks, passing to the right of the remnants of what used to be small trees, to gain that ledge . Continue up the flake/crack and through the two roofs on the left face of the arete and then on to the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack. #4 or 5 for the last part of the flake/crack is nice. A red ballnut or very small brass offset at the crux, but it is mostly psychological pro.

content.description: At the right end of the cliff there is a low overhang with two cracks. The left crack leading left of a pricker bush is Log Jam. The right crack is Flying Racoon. Skamper over the low overhang to gain purchase on the small face holds and crack. Climb the vertical crack until it tops out.
content.protection: Standar Trad Rack

content.description: Straight up the face to the right of Climbing Bind.  Follow a faint water stain and finish on the left-facing protrusion.
content.protection: Originally led with hooks.  Best consider it a top-rope.
content.location: 8 feet right of Climbing Bind.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Climb the small crack that starts just left of the opening of the boulder cave and passes the beige area where a block fell off on the left.  Eventually the crack peters out and you continue straight up the face to the top.
content.protection: Small wires and cams.  Apparently, this is "a hard crack to nut" (groan).  Walk off left on hiking trail.
content.location: On the face above the upper opening of the boulder cave.

content.description: A sweaty crack on the right side of the major part of the cliff offers surprisingly good climbing.  The top-out can be a bit dicey so be careful on the ledges near the end.
content.protection: Standard trad rack, probably could be lead on all passive.

content.description: At the far right side of the cliff are a pair of cracks.  The right most is flying squirrel.  Climb the small overhang (crux) to obtain the crack. Climb up and to the left of another small overhang, dodging a pricker bush (go right) near the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.

content.description:
From the top of the boulder, traverse right to the prominent left-facing corner.  Follow the corner to a small overhang, traverse left, and finish on the Moondog Delight arête. 

  A 5.10+ R variation starts on the ground 10 ft. right of the boulder, beneath the left-facing corner.
content.protection: Standard rack.  You'll want a good spot for the 5.10+ start.  Walk off left on hiking trail.
content.location: Starts on top of the Boulder Cave boulder.

content.description: Start up the left facing corner (same as Slip Knot) to the roof.  Traverse left on tiny feet underneath the roof.  Reach the arête and move down and around it to south facing wall.  Move left on the short wall and finish on low angled wall.
content.protection: standard trad rack. small nuts for the traverse
content.location: left end of the crag. start as for Slip Knot but traverse left under the roof

content.description: Start in the small right-facing corner just left of Franny and Zoey. Shift left a tad at the ledge and slither your way up the dark water streak following the white highlights.
content.protection: Originally led on hooks.  Best considered a top-rope.
content.location: 6 feet left of Franny and Zoey corner.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Work up the cracks between Down-to-Earth and Night Shift.  Bypass the small roof on the right until you reach a small overlap.  Move left and finish on the middle of the face.
content.protection: Top rope.
content.location: Between Down-to-Earth corner and Night Shift crack.  Walk off left on hiking trail.

content.description: Start at the 4 foot high pedestal and ascend the slightly overhanging crack in the middle of the left wall.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Scramble down about 40 feet right of the top.
content.location: At the far right end of the crag on the face left of Twister corner.

content.description: Prominent crack and left-facing corner 15 feet right of Pit Viper.
content.protection: Standard rack
content.location: Walk-off left on blue-blazed trail

content.description: Climb the wider crack just right of 'Solidarity' to a 6 foot high block. Continue up the crack above to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack with some larger cams. Walk off left on hiking trail.
content.location: Start at the top left of the "duck under" block. A more strenuous and reachy start pulls directly through the overhang on good buckets.

content.description: This wooded crag makes an excellent winter crag.  It is south facing and gets sun for most of the afternoon.  The summit offers pleasant views of the eastern side of the ridge.  In the summertime, there are persistent mosquitoes, and the right side of the cliff weeps.
